member.name: T:Avalonia.Layout.AttachedLayout
member.summary: Represents the base class for an object that sizes and arranges child elements for a host.

member.name: E:Avalonia.Layout.AttachedLayout.MeasureInvalidated
member.summary: Occurs when the measurement state (layout) has been invalidated.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Layout.AttachedLayout.MeasureInvalidatedWeakEvent
member.summary: Occurs when the measurement state (layout) has been invalidated.

member.name: E:Avalonia.Layout.AttachedLayout.ArrangeInvalidated
member.summary: Occurs when the arrange state (layout) has been invalidated.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Layout.AttachedLayout.ArrangeInvalidatedWeakEvent
member.summary: Occurs when the arrange state (layout) has been invalidated.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.AttachedLayout.InitializeForContext(Avalonia.Layout.LayoutContext)
member.summary: Initializes any per-container state the layout requires when it is attached to an container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
member.remarks:
Container elements that support attached layouts should call this method when a layout instance is first assigned. The container is expected to give the attached layout instance a way to store and retrieve any per-container state by way of the provided context. It is also the responsibility of the container to not reuse the context, or otherwise expose the state from one layout to another.
When an attached layout is removed the container should release any reference to the layout state it stored.
Override or to provide the behavior for this method in a derived class.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.AttachedLayout.UninitializeForContext(Avalonia.Layout.LayoutContext)
member.summary: Removes any state the layout previously stored on the ILayoutable container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.AttachedLayout.Measure(Avalonia.Layout.LayoutContext,Avalonia.Size)
member.summary: Suggests a DesiredSize for a container element. A container element that supports attached layouts should call this method from their own MeasureOverride implementations to form a recursive layout update. The attached layout is expected to call the Measure for each of the containerâ€™s ILayoutable children.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

The available space that a container can allocate to a child object. A child object can request a larger space than what is available; the provided size might be accommodated if scrolling or other resize behavior is possible in that particular container.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.AttachedLayout.Arrange(Avalonia.Layout.LayoutContext,Avalonia.Size)
member.summary: Positions child elements and determines a size for a container UIElement. Container elements that support attached layouts should call this method from their layout override implementations to form a recursive layout update.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
The final size that the container computes for the child in layout.
member.returns: The actual size that is used after the element is arranged in layout.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.AttachedLayout.InvalidateMeasure
member.summary: Invalidates the measurement state (layout) for all ILayoutable containers that reference this layout.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.AttachedLayout.InvalidateArrange
member.summary: Invalidates the arrange state (layout) for all UIElement containers that reference this layout. After the invalidation, the UIElement will have its layout updated, which occurs asynchronously.

member.summary: Executes a layout pass.

member.summary: Executes the initial layout pass on a layout root.

member.summary: Epsilon value used for certain layout calculations. Based on the value in WPF LayoutDoubleUtil.

member.summary: Calculates a control's size based on its , , , , and .
member.param: The space available for the control.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.LayoutHelper.InvalidateSelfAndChildrenMeasure(Avalonia.Layout.ILayoutable)
member.summary: Invalidates measure for given control and all visual children recursively.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.LayoutHelper.GetLayoutScale(Avalonia.Layout.ILayoutable)
member.summary: Obtains layout scale of the given control.
member.exception: Thrown when control has no root or returned layout scaling is invalid.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.LayoutHelper.RoundLayoutSize(Avalonia.Size,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Rounds a size to integer values for layout purposes, compensating for high DPI screen coordinates.
member.returns: Value of size that will be rounded under screen DPI.
member.remarks: This is a layout helper method. It takes DPI into account and also does not return the rounded value if it is unacceptable for layout, e.g. Infinity or NaN. It's a helper associated with the UseLayoutRounding property and should not be used as a general rounding utility.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.LayoutHelper.RoundLayoutValue(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the value to be used for layout rounding at high DPI.
member.param: Ratio of screen's DPI to layout DPI
member.returns: Adjusted value that will produce layout rounding on screen at high dpi.
member.remarks: This is a layout helper method. It takes DPI into account and also does not return the rounded value if it is unacceptable for layout, e.g. Infinity or NaN. It's a helper associated with the UseLayoutRounding property and should not be used as a general rounding utility.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Layout.LayoutHelper.MinMax
member.summary: Calculates the min and max height for a control. Ported from WPF.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Layout.LayoutManager
member.summary: Manages measuring and arranging of controls.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Layout.NonVirtualizingLayout
member.summary: Represents the base class for an object that sizes and arranges child elements for a host and and does not support virtualization.
member.remarks:
NonVirtualizingLayout is the base class for layouts that do not support virtualization. You can inherit from it to create your own layout.
A non-virtualizing layout can measure and arrange child elements.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.NonVirtualizingLayout.InitializeForContextCore(Avalonia.Layout.LayoutContext)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, initializes any per-container state the layout requires when it is attached to an ILayoutable container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.NonVirtualizingLayout.UninitializeForContextCore(Avalonia.Layout.LayoutContext)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, removes any state the layout previously stored on the ILayoutable container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.NonVirtualizingLayout.MeasureOverride(Avalonia.Layout.NonVirtualizingLayoutContext,Avalonia.Size)
member.summary: Provides the behavior for the "Measure" pass of the layout cycle. Classes can override this method to define their own "Measure" pass behavior.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
The available size that this object can give to child objects. Infinity can be specified as a value to indicate that the object will size to whatever content is available.
member.returns: The size that this object determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of the allocated sizes for child objects or based on other considerations such as a fixed container size.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.NonVirtualizingLayout.ArrangeOverride(Avalonia.Layout.NonVirtualizingLayoutContext,Avalonia.Size)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, provides the behavior for the "Arrange" pass of layout. Classes can override this method to define their own "Arrange" pass behavior.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
The final area within the container that this object should use to arrange itself and its children.
member.returns: The actual size that is used after the element is arranged in layout.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how items are aligned on the non-scrolling or non-virtualizing axis.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.Start
member.summary: Items are aligned with the start of the row or column, with extra space at the end. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.Center
member.summary: Items are aligned in the center of the row or column, with extra space at the start and end. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.End
member.summary: Items are aligned with the end of the row or column, with extra space at the start. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.SpaceAround
member.summary: Items are aligned so that extra space is added evenly before and after each item.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.SpaceBetween
member.summary: Items are aligned so that extra space is added evenly between adjacent items. No space is added at the start or end.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayoutItemsStretch
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how items are sized to fill the available space.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayoutItemsStretch.None
member.summary: The item retains its natural size. Use of extra space is determined by the property.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayoutItemsStretch.Fill
member.summary: The item is sized to fill the available space in the non-scrolling direction. Item size in the scrolling direction is not changed.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayoutItemsStretch.Uniform
member.summary: The item is sized to both fill the available space in the non-scrolling direction and maintain its aspect ratio.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayout
member.summary: Positions elements sequentially from left to right or top to bottom in a wrapping layout.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayout.ItemsJustification
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how items are aligned on the non-scrolling or non- virtualizing axis.
member.value: An enumeration value that indicates how items are aligned. The default is Start.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayout.ItemsStretch
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how items are sized to fill the available space.
member.value: An enumeration value that indicates how items are sized to fill the available space. The default is None.
member.remarks: This property enables adaptive layout behavior where the items are sized to fill the available space along the non-scrolling axis, and optionally maintain their aspect ratio.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayout.MinColumnSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum space between items on the horizontal axis.
member.remarks: The spacing may exceed this minimum value when is set to SpaceEvenly, SpaceAround, or SpaceBetween.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayout.MinItemHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum height of each item.
member.value: The minimum height (in pixels) of each item. The default is NaN, in which case the height of the first item is used as the minimum.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayout.MinItemWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum width of each item.
member.value: The minimum width (in pixels) of each item. The default is NaN, in which case the width of the first item is used as the minimum.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayout.MinRowSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum space between items on the vertical axis.
member.remarks: The spacing may exceed this minimum value when is set to SpaceEvenly, SpaceAround, or SpaceBetween.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayout.MaximumRowsOrColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum row or column count.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayout.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the axis along which items are laid out.
member.value: One of the enumeration values that specifies the axis along which items are laid out. The default is Vertical.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Layout.UniformGridLayoutState
member.summary: Represents the state of a .

member.name: T:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayout
member.summary: Represents the base class for an object that sizes and arranges child elements for a host and supports virtualization.
member.remarks: is the base class for layouts that support virtualization. You can use one of the provided derived class, or inherit from it to create your own layout. Provided concrete virtualizing layout classes are and .

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayout.OnItemsChanged(Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext,System.Object,System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Notifies the layout when the data collection assigned to the container element (Items) has changed.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
member.remarks: Override to provide the behavior for this method in a derived class.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayout.InitializeForContextCore(Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, initializes any per-container state the layout requires when it is attached to an ILayoutable container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayout.UninitializeForContextCore(Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, removes any state the layout previously stored on the ILayoutable container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayout.MeasureOverride(Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext,Avalonia.Size)
member.summary: Provides the behavior for the "Measure" pass of the layout cycle. Classes can override this method to define their own "Measure" pass behavior.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
The available size that this object can give to child objects. Infinity can be specified as a value to indicate that the object will size to whatever content is available.
member.returns: The size that this object determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of the allocated sizes for child objects or based on other considerations such as a fixed container size.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayout.ArrangeOverride(Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext,Avalonia.Size)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, provides the behavior for the "Arrange" pass of layout. Classes can override this method to define their own "Arrange" pass behavior.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
The final area within the container that this object should use to arrange itself and its children.
member.returns: The actual size that is used after the element is arranged in layout.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayout.OnItemsChangedCore(Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext,System.Object,System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Notifies the layout when the data collection assigned to the container element (Items) has changed.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Layout.ElementRealizationOptions
member.summary: Defines constants that specify whether to suppress automatic recycling of the retrieved element or force creation of a new element.
member.remarks: When you call , you can specify whether to suppress automatic recycling of the retrieved element or force creation of a new element. Elements retrieved with automatic recycling suppressed (SuppressAutoRecycle) are ignored by the automatic recycling logic that clears realized elements that were not retrieved as part of the current layout pass. You must explicitly recycle these elements by passing them to the RecycleElement method to avoid memory leaks.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Layout.ElementRealizationOptions.None
member.summary: No option is specified.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Layout.ElementRealizationOptions.ForceCreate
member.summary: Creation of a new element is forced.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Layout.ElementRealizationOptions.SuppressAutoRecycle
member.summary: The element is ignored by the automatic recycling logic.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext
member.summary: Represents the base class for layout context types that support virtualization.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext.ItemCount
member.summary: Gets the number of items in the data.
member.remarks: This property gets the value returned by ItemCountCore, which must be implemented in a derived class.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext.LayoutOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets the origin point for the estimated content size.
member.remarks: LayoutOrigin is used by virtualizing layouts that rely on estimations when determining the size and position of content. It allows the layout to fix-up the estimated origin of the content as it changes due to on-going estimation or potentially identifying the actual size to use. For example, itâ€™s possible that as a user is scrolling back to the top of the content that the layout's estimates for the content size that it reports as part of its MeasureOverride become increasingly accurate. If the predicted position of the content does not already match the previously predicted position (for example, if the size of the elements ends up being smaller than previously thought), then the layout can indicate a new origin. The viewport provided to the layout on subsequent passes will take into account the adjusted origin.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext.RealizationRect
member.summary: Gets an area that represents the viewport and buffer that the layout should fill with realized elements.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext.RecommendedAnchorIndex
member.summary: Gets the recommended index from which to start the generation and layout of elements.
member.remarks: The recommended index might be the result of programmatically realizing an element and requesting that it be brought into view. Or, it may be that a user drags the scrollbar thumb so quickly that the new viewport and the viewport and buffer previously given to the layout do not intersect, so a new index is suggested as the anchor from which to generate and layout other elements.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext.LayoutOriginCore
member.summary: Implements the behavior of LayoutOrigin in a derived or custom VirtualizingLayoutContext.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext.RecommendedAnchorIndexCore
member.summary: Implements the behavior for getting the return value of RecommendedAnchorIndex in a derived or custom .

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext.GetItemAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the data item in the source found at the specified index.
member.param: The index of the data item to retrieve.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext.GetOrCreateElementAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a UIElement that represents the data item in the source found at the specified index. By default, if an element already exists, it is returned; otherwise, a new element is created.
member.param: The index of the data item to retrieve a UIElement for.
member.remarks: This method calls with options set to None. GetElementAtCore must be implemented in a derived class.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext.GetOrCreateElementAt(System.Int32,Avalonia.Layout.ElementRealizationOptions)
member.summary: Retrieves a UIElement that represents the data item in the source found at the specified index using the specified options.
member.param: The index of the data item to retrieve a UIElement for.
A value of that specifies whether to suppress automatic recycling of the retrieved element or force creation of a new element.
member.remarks: This method calls , which must be implemented in a derived class. When you request an element for the specified index, you can optionally specify whether to suppress automatic recycling of the retrieved element or force creation of a new element.Elements retrieved with automatic recycling suppressed(SuppressAutoRecycle) are ignored by the automatic recycling logic that clears realized elements that were not retrieved as part of the current layout pass.You must explicitly recycle these elements by passing them to the RecycleElement method to avoid memory leaks. These options are intended for more advanced layouts that choose to explicitly manage the realization and recycling of elements as a performance optimization.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext.RecycleElement(Avalonia.Layout.ILayoutable)
member.summary: Clears the specified UIElement and allows it to be either re-used or released.
member.remarks: This method calls , which must be implemented in a derived class.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext.ItemCountCore
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, retrieves the number of items in the data.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext.GetItemAtCore(System.Int32)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, retrieves the data item in the source found at the specified index.
member.param: The index of the data item to retrieve.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext.RealizationRectCore
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, retrieves an area that represents the viewport and buffer that the layout should fill with realized elements.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext.GetOrCreateElementAtCore(System.Int32,Avalonia.Layout.ElementRealizationOptions)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, retrieves a UIElement that represents the data item in the source found at the specified index using the specified options.
member.param: The index of the data item to retrieve a UIElement for.
A value of that specifies whether to suppress automatic recycling of the retrieved element or force creation of a new element.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Layout.VirtualizingLayoutContext.RecycleElementCore(Avalonia.Layout.ILayoutable)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, clears the specified UIElement and allows it to be either re-used or released.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Layout.WrapLayout
member.summary: Arranges elements by wrapping them to fit the available space. When is set to Orientation.Horizontal, element are arranged in rows until the available width is reached and then to a new row. When is set to Orientation.Vertical, element are arranged in columns until the available height is reached.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Layout.WrapLayout.HorizontalSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets a uniform Horizontal distance (in pixels) between items when is set to Horizontal, or between columns of items when is set to Vertical.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Layout.WrapLayout.HorizontalSpacingProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Layout.WrapLayout.VerticalSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets a uniform Vertical distance (in pixels) between items when is set to Vertical, or between rows of items when is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Layout.WrapLayout.VerticalSpacingProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Layout.WrapLayout.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the WrapLayout. Horizontal means that child controls will be added horizontally until the width of the panel is reached, then a new row is added to add new child controls. Vertical means that children will be added vertically until the height of the panel is reached, then a new column is added.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Layout.WrapLayout.OrientationProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.
